resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
harrism commented on pull request #5062: [ARROW-6205 ARROW_DEPRECATED warning when including io/interfaces.h from CUDA (.cu) source] Fix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5062
 
 
   ARROW_DEPRECATED on using statements causes warnings when including interfaces.h from CUDA source files (.cu) compiled with nvcc.
   
   This PR works around this issue the same way it is done for MSVC by changing a single preprocessor condition.
   
   Fixes [JIRA 6205 ](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6205?jql=project%20%3D%20ARROW%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20AND%20text%20~%20%22ARROW_DEPRECATED%22%20ORDER%20BY%20priority%20DESC%2C%20updated%20DESC)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

emkornfield commented on pull request #5062: [ARROW-6205 ARROW_DEPRECATED warning when including io/interfaces.h from CUDA (.cu) source] Fix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5062#discussion_r312777169
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/interfaces.h
 ##########
 @@ -191,7 +191,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ReadWriteFileInterface : public RandomAccessFile, public Writ
 };
 
 // TODO(kszucs): remove this after 0.13
 
 Review comment:
   It seems like the right thing to do might be to delete the using statements altogher based on the TODO above? @kszucs?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

harrism commented on pull request #5062: [ARROW-6205 ARROW_DEPRECATED warning when including io/interfaces.h from CUDA (.cu) source] Fix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5062#discussion_r312842094
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/interfaces.h
 ##########
 @@ -191,7 +191,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ReadWriteFileInterface : public RandomAccessFile, public Writ
 };
 
 // TODO(kszucs): remove this after 0.13
 
 Review comment:
   Agreed. I was unsure what "this" referred to in the comment. The whole ifndef and else, or part of it. How long after 0.13 is required? What is it about post-0.13 that makes it possible to remove, etc.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #5062: ARROW-6205: [C++] ARROW_DEPRECATED warning when including io/interfaces.h
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5062#issuecomment-521023727
 
 
   @harrism right, we don't use the GitHub UI to merge PRs, our merge tool creates atomic patches from each pull request and commits those to master, see
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/e41ad0d2ccaf96812d902b161d8a0b2b372f1b72
   
   I'm actually a bit surprised a project with many developers like RAPIDS is able to tolerate a "dirty" commit history (https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/commits/branch-0.9). How do you expect to be able to git-bisect? 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   I've git bisected myself and so have others without problems. log(N) is a very powerful tool.
   
   Thanks for accepting my patch.
